dialogue.text: I did some cleaning today.
Or tried to, at least.
Ami has always been better at that sort of thing. And Niki’s good at anything if she puts her mind to it.
It’s still new to me, though.
Pathetic, I know. But I’ve yet to figure out which chemical concoctions best erase water stains. Or which type of vinegar is the one I’m supposed to use to prevent mold.
I can’t be bothered to look it up either. I just can’t find the motivation. I just don’t care enough.
It’s satisfying, though.
Not the act of cleaning itself, but taking a step back and looking at all you’ve managed to accomplish in just a brief window of time.
Or in my case — how you have accomplished nothing in a window so large that the house itself could fall through it.
It’s satisfying because it’s validating. Just it validates that I am not cut out for this. And I am satisfied because I’ve always loved the way it feels to be right.
I’ve been using that word a lot lately.
{i}Love.{/i}
I’ve been handing it out like candy.
For some reason, when I close my eyes, I can almost taste it.
{i}That{/i} was like vinegar too.
Just it didn’t work the way it was supposed to.
Mold still grows within me to this very day.
Come in.
Hi! Hello. I’m here to annoy you again. This time, with the 1997 PC Classic, Theme Hospital.
Jumping back even further in time, huh? Don’t girls your age typically like modern things more?
I’m going to give you a second to think about what you just said so you can find the flaws yourself without me having to point them out.
I’m glad you’re here, Io.
You are? Why? I suck.
Yeah, but so do I. So being around someone equally shitty makes me somehow feel a little {i}less{/i} shitty.
You’re not shitty at all, though. You’re like my cool, guardian angel — who watches over me and prevents me from feeling like I’m the worst thing in the world.
I literally {i}just{/i} called you shitty.
Yeah, in comparison to {i}you{/i}, who is decidedly {i}un-{/i}shitty.
Either way! Let’s go play games in your room so I stop feeling like I was only put here to suffer!
Is everything okay?
No! Of course not! Nothing is ever okay! Which is a huge part of why a lot of people play games in the first place!
But before I go on a tirade about how that statement applies to the endless rollercoaster, no pun intended, that is my life, how about you just agree and show me to your room?!
Io-

If you’re still feeling bad about what happened the last time I came over and did something like this, don’t be. That was {i}my{/i} fault for putting myself in a situation where I knew it could happen.
But I know you aren’t going to hurt me now. So there’s nothing you need to worry about. Just sit back and let me bother you. I need you today.
You need me?
I mean, realistically, I kind of need you {i}every{/i} day since when I’m {i}not{/i} with you, I’m still thinking about you. But, yeah. Today I guess I {i}really{/i} need you.
And you don’t want to talk about {i}why?{/i}
Nope. I just want to sit in the dark with my favorite person and forget all about it. Please help?
Pleeeeeeease?
Okay, fine. And I promise not to invite you into bed this time.
Fuck yeah! Affection!
You can totally invite me into bed if you want, though. I’d let you hug the life out of me if you felt like it. It’s just all that {i}other{/i} stuff I can’t stomach. But you already know that, so-
I sure do. Let’s just go to my room, okay?
You clearly want to talk more about your weird retro hospital game than your feelings right now and, as always, I am fully supportive of avoiding any and all trauma dumping.
Fuck yeah! Emotional cowardice!
I lead Io to the bedroom.
She doesn’t notice how unclean everything is.
Or maybe she does and she just ignores it. Maybe she’s being polite?
Maybe she’s {i}used{/i} to filth by now after all that’s happened to her? And how I’ve surely only added to that by rubbing off on her over time.

We sit with our shoulders close together. They brush against each other every once in a while — each one accompanied by a small flinch before she remembers I don’t {i}want{/i} to hurt her. I just {i}will.{/i}
It needs to install first. It might take a second.
That’s fine. I’ll just be thankful for this moment of awkward silence in the meantime.
And {i}I’ll{/i} be thankful your laptop still has a disc drive that allows me to install this in the first place. Those aren’t exactly common anymore.
Yeah, well, when it comes to being behind the times in terms of technology and...the Internet...and the concept of growing up as a whole, I’m your guy.
What’s in the “Math Homework” folder on your desktop?
Math homework. I am a very organized, intellectual man.
It’s porn, isn’t it?
I don’t even know what that means. As I said, I am very behind the times in terms of technology and-
So you don’t mind if I open it then.
Please don’t. A man’s math homework folder should remain hidden from even those he trusts the most.
There’s some weird stuff in there, isn’t there?
I’m surprised you even want to know given who you are as a person.
I work in a bathhouse. I’m used to nudity, Sensei. Besides, I think it’s kind of funny. Like...porn as a whole. Would I watch it on my own? No. But I won’t think less of you for doing it.
Unless you still have those pictures of Uta from when she was a kid in there.
Put you on the spot, huh?
Io-
Don’t worry. It’s not really my place to weigh in anymore now that she’s straight up told both of us that she’s okay with you having them.
Oh, look! It finished installing.
You...{i}can{/i} weigh in if you want.
I think it’s...great that you want to protect your friend. And I know that holding onto something I never should have had in the first place was wrong.
So...you can weigh in. You can call me out. I know you haven’t gotten it all out of your system yet.
Just because I...left {i}you{/i} alone...doesn’t mean I-
There are a lot of really bad people in this world, Sensei.
We both know that.
But not all of them understand that what they’re doing is even wrong to begin with. Like that douchebag who posted Uta’s pictures online in the first place.
{i}Or the woman who used to torture me.{/i}
{i}You don’t have to-{/i}
{i}No, it’s...{/i}
{i}I mean, it’s not fine. But there’s no sense in hiding it from you anymore now that it’s out in the open. {/i}
{i}Like, shit, the whole fucking class probably knows after that stupid trivia show thing. And talking about it always just makes it worse, but...{/i}
{i}On the off chance that a place like Heaven exists, cursing her any chance I get can remind the gods or...angels or...whoever makes the guest list to keep her off of it. {/i}
{i}Even Hell would be too cold for a demon like her.{/i}
You’re going to be good, right?
Because you know what will happen if you {i}aren’t{/i} good, right?
You’ll send Sir Meowington back to the shelter.
And?
No dinner. No computer. No games. No anything.
And if the doctor asks you how you’re feeling? Do you remember that too?
I’m having a hard time getting adjusted to my new school.
Because?
Because everyone hates me.
That’s not what we discussed.
It’s the truth, though.
Do you know {i}why{/i} they hate you, Io?
Because I’m not like them.
Because you’re an ungrateful, disobedient, obnoxious little brat who insists on ruining the lives of {i}everyone{/i} you speak to.
I’m sorry.
Well, you won’t have to be sorry for long...
You’ll be getting home-schooled as soon as that useless father of yours finishes the paperwork.
You know what that means, don’t you?
You’ll be my teacher.
And Mommy’s already taught you so much, hasn’t she? Are you excited to learn more?
Can we just move again instead?
{i}What did you just say?{/i}
{i}This{/i} is why the kids at school hate you. {i}This{/i} is what makes you ungrateful.

I {i}made{/i} you. I put a roof over your head. I buy you nice clothes...all the games you want...those fucking {i}animals{/i} that {i}I{/i} have to feed, and {i}this{/i} is how you say thanks for all of that?
I’m sorry.
No, you’re not. You’re never sorry. You’re a useless child who can’t follow even the simplest of directions. The kind that only a mother could love.
What will you do if {i}I{/i} start to hate you next, Io? Where will you go? Are you going to live out on the street? Become a fucking {i}whore?{/i} Is {i}that{/i} your plan?
I’ll be good.
{i}Good.{/i} Because if you’re not, I’ll-
Um...{i}excuse me?{/i} Can I help you?
{i}Yasu! Move! What are you doing?!{/i}
Would you mind controlling your child? My daughter has {i}anxiety.{/i} She’s not equipped to speak to random, weird little girls who want to stare at her for no fucking reason.
I-I’m sorry. She’s not well. Yasu, move. {i}Now.{/i}
Bad woman...
{i}What?...{/i}
I’m so sorry! She thinks she sees things! And she’s always hearing these {i}voices{/i} and-
And you think I {i}care?!{/i} Get your fucking freak away from my little girl or I’ll call the police. This is harassment. Who’s your doctor? Are you even supposed to be here?
S-Sorry! We were just leaving!
But-
{i}Shh! Will you ever stop embarrassing me?! You can't just stare at other girls like that! I don’t care what you think you heard! Just...be normal!{/i}
Tch. The nerve of some people.
Clearly, not everyone is cut out to be a mother.
Go to the bathroom and fix your hair before your appointment. We can stop for ice cream on the way home if you do a good job.
I’m tired. I don’t want ice cream.

Yes you do. You love ice cream. Now, go. You look like a fucking mess. Almost as bad as that other girl. People are going to think I abuse you. Do you {i}want{/i} that? Do you {i}want{/i} to make me look bad?
I’m sorry. I-
That’s it. No computer. No games. You’ll sit in your room and read until Mommy has a job for you. Do you understand?
I’m sorry.
You’ve been...sitting there in silence for like five minutes now, Io.
I’m sorry.
{i}Why?{/i}
Because I’m sorry for everything. That’s just...how I am.
I know it’s not my fault. But I still can’t help but say it. It’s like...a reflex, almost.
Like, if I’m not constantly apologizing, everything I care about is going to be taken away. And I’ll be all alone in the dark...in the glow of some old laptop, waiting for my pills to kick in.
Why can’t I be happy, Sensei?
I ask myself the same question all the time.
But you know what will {i}make{/i} you happy....
And it’s something {i}I{/i} can help with...
So I will.
Io-
It’s hard.
Do you mind if it’s under the table?...
Do I mind if {i}what{/i} is under the table, Io?
Are you asking because you genuinely don’t know? Or because you want to hear me say it?
The latter — but only because I want you to snap out of whatever it is that’s going on with you right now.
Let me make you happy, Sensei. As payment for spending time with me today. It's the least I can do.
You don’t need to {i}pay{/i} me, Io. You don’t need to do any of this.
But it’s hard.
That means you want it, right?
Of course I {i}want{/i} it, but-
It’s just my hand...
This much, I can stomach.
It’s so big...
You’re so-
No.
{i}No?{/i}
No.
But I...
I started it. {i}I{/i} chose to do this. So you don’t have to feel guilty about-
I said no.
Do you know what that word means?
To me, it meant nothing for a very long time.
And now?
Now, I’m just...confused.
Do you like me or...do you not like me?
I like you. But I’m not going to force you to do anything.
But...you’re not! Like I said, this is {i}my{/i} choice! {i}I{/i} intended to do this today!
Okay. Then I won’t let you force {i}yourself{/i} either.
Why...not?
Because I never want to see you like that again.
I never want to see you like that again either...
Was it scary?
Yeah.
But you still like me either way? You’re not just lying about it because you’re afraid of change?
I like you...a lot.
Then take your hand off of me...
Okay?
Okay...
Io and I spend the rest of the afternoon holding hands and playing video games in the dark.
I feel like a kid again. I imagine she does too.
But I’m confused about why we like it.
Eventually, she leaves. But she keeps the game here.
I keep playing until it’s dark everywhere, not just in my room.
And before I know it, I’m looking down at a chat window full of pictures of my progress, with her name plastered to the top of it.
{i}Io’s affection has increased by 5!{/i}
